page.title: 10Debenham;cottage renovation.
page.content: Since 1960,many farm cottages have been sold and renovated with grant aid. This has resulted in some very attractive restoration to about 75% of the old cottages.Extensions were needed to most cottages since in their original state there were no toilets other than garden privies and no bath- rooms. The influx of people into an expanding village has made for higher expectations with regard to housing and sanitation. The district council has been fairly liberal in its approach to planning permission,yet has managed to prevent inappropriate alterations.Prices for period cottages compare favourably with other parts of south-eastern England. There is a lack of housing in the middle price-range in Debenham,driving prospective first-time purchasers away.
